tweets.text: Meanwhile. The Rhea, a significant tributary to the #Lugg is running a colour most of us would expect good hot chocolate to be. #Herefordshire is famous for its rich red #soils. Right now we're sending a lot of it to other counties! https://t.co/KJ25XPksrN
Camels are munching on plastic, and the results are deadly https://t.co/x2kkCQpLGM
@NeoVanMan @EnvAgency Just need a touch of famine and the year will be rounded off properly
@NeoVanMan @EnvAgency Oh yes, it is quite prone to flooding I believe.  It hasn't stopped raining here since some time in October, the ground is sodden.
Can see why we've had a flood warning from the @EnvAgency https://t.co/eRRwxdARFt
@CAKubicki @EnvAgency It's the Ouse near York.
@NeoVanMan @EnvAgency Looks full but lovely.  Which river is that?

Some exciting initiatives afoot for the @TheEPS1 flood resilience professional working group for 2021! @ShellE666 @BeFloodReady @EnvAgency @NatFloodForum Helping promote flood preparedness #flood #befloodready
@AgainstSewage @EnvAgency I can smell it in Norfolk 💩clearly Sewage fungus 🧐& to quote @Feargal_Sharkey “and the @EnvAgency does what exactly “
@timthefruit @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @HelenStace_HWT what a disgrace this is

You learn something new every day they say!

Well I never knew that sewage fungus could grow on a concrete step just below this sewage outfall pipe.  Pretty obvious where the pollution is coming from don't you think @EnvAgency? 🤔

Not helping the discharge area is it?  🤨 https://t.co/BJUp2UPvSL

tweets.text:
Please stay away from #flood water and flooded rivers, submerged paths can hide unknown hazards. Just a few inches of flowing water can sweep you off your feet. 

#Staysafe https://t.co/ST031AWRon
Pumps, barriers, gates, flood storage areas and more in action across the patch helping reduce flood risk to communities. https://t.co/CXIE1m9BnR

Our teams have been busy across the region checking watercourses and clearing trash screens to keep water flowing freely. This is the Pill Outfall, #Somerset before and after. #floodaware https://t.co/DB2UpobMUd

1/2 - In the last 24 hours widespread rain has fallen on Somerset's already wet catchments. Spillways are running and pumps will be switched on as river levels allow. We are using the Sowy flood relief channel to help mange flows in the Parrett and Tone.

tweets.text: Building leaky dams in this weeks heavy rain, strong winds & clarty ground conditions was tricky. This almost completed dam is 17m wide. Our 3d model estimates it will store 800 cubic m. A landscape scale #nfm project above Staveley for @SCRiversTrust @EnvAgencyNW #LakeDistrict https://t.co/Bau0O1hlWn
Before and after, Pill Outfall, Blue Anchor.  Our field teams keeping communities safe.  Fantastic work @AdrianGovierEA @FieldOpsEA team. 👏 @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/k6XJN9nTWk

Some ‘technical challenges’ today but ultimately we prevailed with a successful and very valuable gauging at Bealsmill on the River Inny. 25 cumecs gauges on the recession limb for @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/lq5zyEmmg4

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text: No news is good news! Whilst the river gauge over the past week looks like a rollercoaster thankfully the rain has held off enough to avoid barriers being deployed so far. With all our COVID work currently it's quite a relief! @BoATownCouncil @DWFRSBoA @EnvAgencySW @WiltsPrepared https://t.co/m0OWnbwT7v

@xrunnerwill @DCfieldteamsEA @johncurtinEA @jamiemcclaughl1 @EnvAgencySW @MariaHerlihyEA @MoretonBack1 #TeamEA kept us all safe & sound thanks Will. Busy week, we were out with Keith & Jake at 0300hrs in Mevagissey on Wed morning for coastal flooding & then out last night for surface water & river flooding. Busy week for forecasting, field, incident  and monitoring teams this week
@bbcweather @DrLizBentley @NatResWales @EnvAgency Fortunately conditions weren't as bad as forecast

Friday was a very wet day for parts of the country, but especially so across the higher ground of #Wales and southwest #England

Here is a look at the top 5 wettest places yesterday

Data provided by * @EnvAgency  and ^@NatResWales https://t.co/WsOFITwbJa
There are still 7 flood warnings and 14 flood alerts in place across #Cornwall this morning. @EnvAgencySW says teams will be in action continuing the clear up throughout the day.

On duty today as the area Flood Operation duty officer, our teams are out across the area @EnvAgencyMids We have Barriers erected and being looked after 24/7 at #Hereford #Shrewsbury #Bewdley we are also checking and clearing  #trashscreens (All other barriers loaded and ready ) https://t.co/awkpt6VlwM

tweets.text: Ooh this is so good, lovely @slowtheflow_UK piece too and a cheeky bonus I’m in background with team Slow The Flow @adrianandkim we do some amazing stuff here in Calderdale @Calderdale @CalderdaleFound @EnvAgencyYNE @ScottAPatient https://t.co/Kq6n2lwFo1
@xrunnerwill @EnvAgencySW Hi Will, looks great! Where can we find local data please. Would love to see the result of your hard work! 🙌
@NickyGeeson @VisitDeanWye Yes it turns red whenever it rains hard. Not good. The @EnvAgency is trying to help reduce this, I think?
@AnaGuerreroPT @EnvAgency @ViridorUK https://t.co/M9yoxoHKd3

@lilrobbergirl @VerValleySoc @Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency General public need to learn that storm drains like this need to go through both settling ponds (with proper machine access to allow de-silting and maintenance) and a wetland to enable bioremidiation of water, this also needs to be accessible for long term management.

The @EnvAgencyMids #Worcester field team aka the #Jteam of Jon, Jim & Joe have fired up the mobile Pumps deployed to reduce water levels in #Powick #Worcestershire #reducingfloodrisk https://t.co/oo0QDLQCzq
